snippet: Bill’s Gay Nineties Restaurant and Piano Bar is set to close at its location on East 54th Street after spending nearly 90 years there.
abstract: Bill’s Gay Nineties Restaurant and Piano Bar is set to close at its East Side location after 90 years; establishment, which opened in 1924 as a speakeasy during Prohibition, is shutting its doors after the building's owner refused to renegotiate the lease; owner Barbara Bart Olmsted plans to reopen at a new location nearby.
lead_paragraph: Bill’s Gay Nineties Restaurant and Piano Bar is set to close at its location on East 54th Street after spending nearly 90 years there.

headline.seo: Bill’s Gay Nineties Is Set to Close at Its Longtime Location
headline.main: A Bar That Survived Prohibition Is Set to Be Uprooted Over a Lease
headline.print_headline: An Establishment That Survived Prohibition Is Set to Be Uprooted Over a Lease
